In this example, a multiple regression model is fitted
using program quality ratings (`QUALITY`) as the regressand/outcome variable
and number of published articles attributed to the program faculty members (`NARTIC`),
percent of faculty members holding research grants (`PCTGRT`), and
percentage of program graduates who received support (`PCTSUPP`) as regressor/predictor variables
using a data set from 1982 ratings of 46 doctoral programs in psychology in the USA (National Research Council, 1982).
Confidence intervals for the standardized regression coefficients are generated
using the `BetaNB()` function from the `betaNB` package.


``` r
library(betaNB)
```




``` r
df <- betaNB::nas1982
```

### Regression

Fit the regression model using the `lm()` function.


``` r
object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)
```

### Nonparametric Bootstrap


``` r
nb <- NB(object)
```

### Standardized Regression Slopes


``` r
out <- BetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)
```

## Methods

### summary

Summary of the results of `BetaNB()`.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "pc")
#> Call:
#> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Standardized regression slopes
#> type = "pc"
#>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0727 5000 0.3514 0.6367
#> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0765 5000 0.2338 0.5398
#> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0791 5000 0.1087 0.4140
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bc")
#> Call:
#> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bc"
#>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0727 5000 0.3493 0.6345
#> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0765 5000 0.2417 0.5456
#> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0791 5000 0.1134 0.4228
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bca")
#> Call:
#> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bca"
#>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0727 5000 0.3502 0.6361
#> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0765 5000 0.2500 0.5513
#> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0791 5000 0.1076 0.4138
```

### coef

Return the vector of estimates.


``` r
coef(out)
#>    NARTIC    PCTGRT   PCTSUPP 
#> 0.4951451 0.3914887 0.2632477
```

### vcov

Return the sampling covariance matrix.


``` r
vcov(out)
#>               NARTIC       PCTGRT      PCTSUPP
#> NARTIC   0.005280800 -0.003182207 -0.001926817
#> PCTGRT  -0.003182207  0.005852286 -0.001944548
#> PCTSUPP -0.001926817 -0.001944548  0.006253215
```

### confint

Return confidence intervals.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "pc")
#>             2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC  0.3513572 0.6366968
#> PCTGRT  0.2338131 0.5398069
#> PCTSUPP 0.1086715 0.4139600
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bc")
#>             2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC  0.3493215 0.6344952
#> PCTGRT  0.2416590 0.5455828
#> PCTSUPP 0.1133506 0.4227719
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bca")
#>             2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC  0.3501650 0.6361288
#> PCTGRT  0.2499815 0.5512806
#> PCTSUPP 0.1076107 0.4137751
```
